intro: Lapathum bucephalophorum, commonly known as the broad-leaved betony, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as mint and lavender. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, purple-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or meadows. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological gardens and traditional herbal medicine.
